attributes.action: End industrial breeding of domestic pets to protect the welfare of  animals.
attributes.background:
The Australian Government has just introduced new legislation into Parliament. Their Domestic Animals Act protects the welfare of breeding animals to ensure that their pets come from good homes.
By overhauling the Animal Welfare Act 2006, we in the UK can reform breeding and pet shop industries.
attributes.additional_details:
• Reduce the number of fertile female dogs a breeder can keep.

• Crack down on backyard breeders, so they will have to register with their council as a Domestic Animal Business.

• Establish a Registry of these businesses, giving councils the information to determine who is eligible to register as a breeder and better police the new laws.

• Pet shops will no longer be able to sell puppies and kittens unless they have come from a registered breeder, foster home, animal shelter or charity.

• Foster Carers who look after pets waiting for new homes will have clearer rights and responsibilities – caring for animals without having to register as a Domestic Animal Business, but with the benefit from reduced council registration fees.

attributes.action: Gelatine in our food must be marked what animal it is from and in bold writing.
attributes.background: Gelatine is in our food, sweets, pharmaceutical products and many other products. If a product contains Gelatine, it must be written what animal it is from and it must be in bold writing. Food products that contain Gelatine must be clearly marked in bold writing Not suitable for vegetarians.

attributes.action: Urge the Norwegian Government to end the culling of wild wolves
attributes.background: Norway has announced that it plans to allow hunters to kill 47 wolves living in the wild, despite the species being listed as "critically endangered" on the 2015 Norwegian list of endangered animals. This represents the cull of up to two-thirds of the country's total wild wolf population.
attributes.additional_details:
- Rovdata recorded a wolf population of between 65-68 in winter 2015-2016.
- Nina Jensen, the head of the Norwegian branch of the WWF has called the plans "outright mass slaughter".
- Illustrative datapoint: a 2010 study by the U.S. Department of Agriculture showed that out of 1.7 million cattle deaths that year, only 2.3 percent were caused by predators (of which many are attributed to dogs and other predator species).
- The UK considers itself as a leader in animal welfare standards.

attributes.action: BRING BACK THE NIT NURSE
attributes.background: We all know that the little critters are at large within schools. But they have got significantly worse over recent years. Bringing back the nit nurse would give those parents who don't regularly check their children's hair the extra push they need.
attributes.additional_details: It is unfair on all children involved. I myself have had to treat my daughter 3 times in the 2 weeks she's been back at school. This is almost abuse. Let's help all people involved.

attributes.action: Recommission Britannia and give the Queen her boat back - she's earned it!
attributes.background: The Queen has been selfless in her work for this country and the Commonwealth. We took one her great loves away from her and its about time Great Britain and the Commonwealth gave her something back.
attributes.additional_details: This would also benefit Great Britain in its pursuit of international trade deals following its exit from the EU.

The British People demand that When the next Conservative Leader is elected They Sign a Statement of intent Has to when They will invoke Article 50 Before the end of 2016
To reasure the Business World stability And the British Nation
attributes.additional_details:
It is now important that the Goverment 
Stand and deliver on the democratic vote of this nation and come clean on there intentions No more dirty tricks lies and misleading information When will article 50 or Preferably article 72 be signed

attributes.action: Re enact the 1955 canal closure act of parliament.
attributes.background: The Northern reaches of the Lancaster canal were cut off from the main line in 1968.To make way for the M6 motorway,the Locks were de commissioned and the canal was severed in several locations.We propose restoration by stages,to encourage New businesses ,especially tourism.
attributes.additional_details: We have support from numerous boating ,restoration societies.And over 500 members of our group.OWD LANKY BOATERS.Both parish and county councils have show support also.

attributes.action: Support the provision of new bomb detection equipment to Baghdad checkpoints.
attributes.background: On the 2nd of July, 165 innocent Iraqis were killed in the Karrada district of Baghdad in a massive explosion near a shopping mall by car bomb- a truck to be precise.  Another car bomb explosion took the lives of around 100 innocent shoppers at a market in Baghdad a month before. The list is long.
attributes.additional_details: There are many Checkpoints in Baghdad. Police are still using fake bomb detectors bought via a bogus British businessman who was jailed in the UK over the deal 3 years ago. Iraqi Prime minister called for an end to their use. It is frustrating to see that so many innocent lives could be saved using modern security technologies, which the UK is a world leader in. I call on the British government to openly support the Iraqi authority in replacing bomb detection equipment at checkpoints.

attributes.action: Subsidise Care Fees for the elderly by using money from  Overseas Aid.
attributes.background: Why should the elderly have to sell their homes to fund their care when billions are spent, much of it wasted, on foreign aid.  Surely we should look after our own first, before borrowing money to spend on foreigners.

attributes.action: SUSPEND THE £118,000,000.00 GIVEN BY UK TO BURMA THIS YEAR INDEFINITELY
attributes.background:
Britain must save money,especially before uncertain times like BREXIT, when ID CHECKS at hospitals are proposed,the question is,why's BURMA set to receive £118 million from the British taxpayer
when clearly committing crimes against humanity,
and addressing it is the responsibility of all humanity
attributes.additional_details:
PM meeting with Burmese State Counsellor Aung San Suu Kyi: 13/09/16 -Downing Street spokesperson said: "The Prime Minister said we stood ready to provide further assistance as Burma continues to develop, including through £118 million in support this year."

Yale study suggested that the abuse of the more than one million Rohingya may amount to genocide;a confidential United Nations report to the Security Council says it may constitute “crimes against humanity under international criminal law.”

attributes.action: £369 million proposed for Buckingham Palace to be used to fund Social Housing
attributes.background:
The Queen has been given a 66% payrise that will facilitate a £369 million refurbishment. 
Funnily enough the countless homeless on the Queen's own doorstep will not have enough points or be able to bid for any of the vacant rooms. Give this money to build social housing for the homeless.

attributes.action: Rethink the way dla assess babies born and affected by talipes (clubfoot)
attributes.background: My son was born in 2011 with talipes( clubfoot in 1 of his feet) it was turned inwards. From 3 days old he had a full leg cast on, every week we went a 102 mile round trip to see his consultant, At 3 months his tendon cut and then he wore ponsetti boots and bar -firstly for 23hrs a day then 12hrs.
attributes.additional_details: He couldnt kick his legs freely, he couldnt roll over in his bed to get comfortable. He was stuck on his back thumping a metal bar with his little blue boots attached. Some people get dla as the assessor see it requires 'more care' than a normal baby, but like myself we didnt.My son did require more care, and as he got older with the boots on it got harder on him and myself. Dla needs to address this and make a serious decision to if all should get it or none.They are born with this abnormality

attributes.action: Make the sale of non-approved spring traps illegal.
attributes.background:
At present it is only illegal to USE non-approved traps. 
The law should be extended to ban the SALE of any trap not approved under the Spring Traps Approval Order 2012.
attributes.additional_details:
The present loop-hole allows sellers to sell inferior imported traps that have not been type-approved by DEFRA. This causes unnecessary suffering as these inferior traps often maim rather than give an instant kill. 

These imports are undemining the businesses in the UK that manufacture the genuine approved products.

attributes.action: Implement a 12 month ban for using mobiles while driving.
attributes.background: Far too many people are still ignoring the fact that people are being injured and killed daily due to mobile phone distraction behind the wheel. If you get caught driving and using your phone you should face the same punishment as drink drivers and be banned from driving for 12 months.
attributes.additional_details:
More than 500,000 drivers still using mobile phones at wheel, study shows
At least one in 20 drivers aged under 30 have been caught flouting the law 
Report said using hand-held device is more dangerous than drink or drugs
In 2013, mobile phone use behind the wheel was factor in 22 fatal collisions


Read more: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/

attributes.action: Abolish the "standard living allowance" under 35!
attributes.background: I am 21 years of age. I was made homeless two weeks ago, I have done everything I possibly could while working part time to get my own place. The government will only pay for me to live in shared accommodation of £210 a month.
attributes.additional_details: I spent long enough explaining to them I am unable to live in shared accommodation due to my mental health issues. I have tried to get a one bed flat and nothing I do for universal credit is good enough. How can the government expect our future generation to live with their parents till 35 because most of us can't get help to live alone! Why are we expected to live like students? Why do they not care for people with mental or physical health disabilities? I now have two options. Live on my friends couch, or move back with my parents which I cannot do. Is this acceptable to keep our younger generation in such horrible circumstances?

attributes.action: Ban the taking of photographs of children in school without the child's consent
attributes.background: The concept of private life is a broad one which encompasses the right to identity.  A pupil's image reveals his or her unique characteristics and constitutes one of the chief attributes of his or her personality.
attributes.additional_details: A child, over the age of 12, must be able to give or withdraw consent to the taking of his or her images in addition to the wishes and feelings of the parents/legal guardians.  At present, there are guidelines published by the Information Commissioners Office as to the taking of photographs at schools.  We argue that this is not sufficient because the use of personal mobile phones within a class room setting by a tutor is not prohibited.

attributes.action: Introduce a maximum term limit for the role of UK Prime Minister
attributes.background: Many countries limit the time that one individual can hold the highest political office. This prevents one individual from dominating the political agenda for too long and amassing too much power. Thus it helps to guard against authoritarianism and the domination of particular interest groups.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of countries in the world have term limits for their Heads of State. This is a widely accepted international norm.

Often these limits apply to presidents rather than prime ministers. However, since the UK is a monarchy, and the Prime Minister is more powerful than the monarch in policy making, it is appropriate to impose such a limit on UK prime ministers.

At a time when the personal power of political leaders is so important, this law is critical to preserving political freedoms.

attributes.action: Call on the government to encourage Concorde to return to the skies.
attributes.background: Concorde was an amazing supersonic passenger aircraft which was in service between London, Paris, New York and Washington DC. Unfortunately it stopped its services in 2003, making an end to supersonic travel. It's ridiculous that today it takes 8 hours to go to New York when before it was only 3.

attributes.action: Build HS2 up to an expanded Doncaster Sheffield Airport (DSA)
attributes.background: DSA is soon to be linked to the M18 a new dual carriageway, the A1 being one junction along the M18 and the M1 only three junctions away.  There is a "lot" of room available for an extra runway, new train station/terminal/parking. DSA has one of the longest runways in the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently a train journey from London Kings Cross to London Heathrow takes 51 mins. The fastest train from Kings Cross to Doncaster is 95 mins using existing lines and railway stock, this could be vastly reduced if HS2 were to be built in this direction noting that DSA is also 6 miles South of Doncaster station, giving an extra reduction in transfer time.

Expansion can then be progressed in the North via HS3 and the proposed road route across the Pennines to Manchester.

attributes.action: Tighter regulation on the resale of events tickets.
attributes.background: I tried to buy 'Harry Potter and the Cursed Child'. It became clear that many of these tickets were going up onto other sites for hundreds and in some cases thousands of pounds more. Many of these tickets are failing to sell resulting in empty seats in the theatre on performance night.
attributes.additional_details:
I propose that more rigorous legislation is introduced to prevent these websites from being allowed to sell tickets for more than 10% of the face value. 

We cannot allow these websites to dictate the prices to see our favourite shows/bands/sports teams.

Why should these touts be the only people that benefit?

attributes.action: Hear the voices of the young adult disabled fighting to be heard
attributes.background: From the age of 18 young disabled people are put into the adult age bracket, but little or nothing is offered for this age group. Overnight they lose majority of the help given to children and do not come into account again until they become pensioners. Though mentally they are still children.
attributes.additional_details: Young adults are forgotten when it comes to living as normal a life as possible. Government need to make it law that they are entitled to the same as childrens services instead of leaving it to their parents. Some of who are elderly or even disabled themselves.

attributes.action: Legislation to curb newspapers from knowingly printing factual inaccuracies.
attributes.background: Given the major complaint during the EU referendum was one of factual inaccuracies there should be a way to hold newspapers to account without limiting freedom of the press. If a lie is told on the front page the apology/correction should also be on the front page thus making them more accountable.
attributes.additional_details:
The press in the UK is currently beyond reproach. It can print a headline that is totally untrue and currently only be forced to print a small correction where most will not see it. 
Recognising the freedom of the press is sacrosanct we must act to ensure they are accountable in a way that does not impinge upon this. Forcing them to give equal space to which the falsehood was printed under regulation by an independent body would help deter them from knowingly printing lies for political gain.

attributes.background: Users of companies such as Hermes regularly suffer lost parcels, parcels left out in the open, thrown over walls, in bins, squashed through letterboxes etc. These companies provide totally inadequate compensation, often refusing to accept responsibility, investigate or compensate.

Some examples of common practise by these companies:

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/weird-news/9-times-delivery-drivers-drove-customers-to-despair-a6745546.html

A litany of complaints by frustrated users with no avenue to turn to:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/490161297788303/

attributes.action: Don't add the age verification and censoring of "non-conventional" on porn sites
attributes.background: Age verification checks on porn websites will be hard to implement. ISPs already offer many ways to do this without having to risk personal information. If age verification is done using credit card then dodgy websites may take advantage of this.
attributes.additional_details:
The government should not be allowed to decide what types of porn people are allowed to watch. As long as its consenting, over-18 adults, and it does not go against current law then it should be perfectly fine to show online.

Implementing age verification on to websites will be very risky if it uses personal information to check you are over-18. Lots of porn sites have been hacked recently so that is also a big concern. Parental controls can be easily setup so this is unneeded.

attributes.action: Allow life Imprisonment for cat killers
attributes.background:
People are not scared to kill cats or other animals, as is shown with the Croydon cat killer, he has slaughtered hundreds of cats. However, the maximum sentence for killing a cat is 6 months imprisonment. 
This will not deter awful criminals from ending a poor cat's life.
attributes.additional_details:
More details
http://www.express.co.uk/news/nature/664265/Croydon-cat-killer-jailed-weeks-campaigners-call-for-tougher-sentencing-animal-cruelty 
Animal abusers are locked up for just weeks before coming out and killing again.

attributes.action: Make Politics a mandatory subject for the primary curriculum.
attributes.background: Elections in the US and the recent Brexit vote demonstrate key decisions that the people need to have a good background in Politics to vote on. Giving an education promotes this exploration of politics earlier than just 6 months before a referendum/election. Students can make up their own mind.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-1.png

http://www.populus.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/04/Remain-and-leave-2.png

People need the chance to have an educated vote, not voting on personality or party without understanding.

attributes.action: Make cyclists pay road tax and insurance, and have a licence plate.
attributes.background:
The other day I was stopped at traffic lights.
A cyclist overtook me and went straight through the red light and turned left narrowly missing a car coming from the other direction.
Fortunately there was not an accident but there could have been.

This isn't the first time I've seen this happen.
attributes.additional_details: A registration number would help convicting cyclists for traffic offences.

attributes.action: Urgently bring forward the planned works to the A417 missing link / Birdlip Hill
attributes.background: The A417 birdlip hill (Gloucester) is a notorious accident black spot and is gridlocked on a daily basis, which has a huge impact on commuters, businesses and visitors to the area. The planned works to improve the road much be brought forward as soon as possible to rectify this horrendous situation
attributes.additional_details: http://a417missinglink.co.uk

attributes.action: Bring back public information films showing the dangers HGV drivers face
attributes.background: HGV drivers are constantly put in danger due to the way that other road users behave toward us when a car joins a motorway or pulls out into the line of on coming HGVs and explaining safe distances
attributes.additional_details: Increasing dash cam footage found on most online forums within the industry

attributes.action: Raise university tuition fees using current CPI, not forecasted RPIX
attributes.background: This petition urges the government to use CPI (currently at 0.5%) to increase tuition fees instead of the 2.8% forecasted rate from the Office of Budget Responsibility. This rate will benefit students more, whilst also covering the cost of inflation for universities.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the HE Bill universities are already publishing new tuition fees of £9250 per year, an increase of just under 2.8%. Currently, no rate of inflation published by ONS is close to 2.8% and RPIX, the rate the government is making calculations on, is only 1.5%. 2.8% is a 10 year forecast for RPIX. To put tutition fees in line with inflation a new tuition fee should be calculated each year using CPI figures at the time.

attributes.action: Ensure disabled people are not treated less favourably when winning sport events
attributes.background: The equalities aft is clear there should be no discrimination against people who have a disability ..prise money should be equal to all people irrespective of whether they are disabled or not ..

attributes.action: Make age appropriate basic life support mandatory in the national curriculum.
attributes.background:
Give all children a chance to be life savers with age appropriate basic life support mandatory in the national curriculum in every school year.
Starting with getting help, calling 999, and going on to Asthma, Anaphylaxis, AEDs, CPR, Choking, and more.
attributes.additional_details: AEDs are automated external defibrillators, safe to use and already found in many published places such as train stations and malls.

attributes.action: Urgently review age-based referrals for breast cancer screening women under 30.
attributes.background:
Under 30's automatically considered as non-urgent referral of up to 3 months.

Over 30's can expect to be seen within days/weeks.

Both can have same symptoms. 

This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.edinburghnews.scotsman.com/news/health/mum-with-breast-cancer-urges-women-to-trust-their-instincts-1-4089771

https://www.gofundme.com/breastiesin20s

attributes.action: Inculde more safety elements in the driving test towards motorcycle awareness
attributes.background: too often cars drift around their lanes freely instead of staying straight, especially when moving slowly, this makes filtering through traffic Dangerous! Car drivers pay very little attention to motorcyclist. While I was learning to drive a car, not one thing was ever mentioned about a motorbike!
attributes.additional_details:
I personally have been hit by 2 cars within 2 years and neither of them were my fault, this could be easily avoided if people where taught about motorcyclists while learning to drive! I have witnessed more times than I care to count, cars use their full acceleration in traffic to move from a slow moving lane to a faster moving lane without thought of a motorcycle. They do this as they are not taught about about motorcyclist! This WILL save lives.

Thanks you for reading and please sign & share

attributes.action: Stop funding charities that pay executives and employees  excessive wages
attributes.background:
Charities are funded & given huge sums of money from the government with out any conditions & this money is rarely used for the purpose it was intended
instead it is mostly put in the pockets of its employees in the form of extortionate wages employee wages including executives should be capped
attributes.additional_details: http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2550648/Fury-234-000-salary-boss-Save-Children-Charity-chiefs-huge-wages-reined-say-MPs.html

attributes.action: Take military action against the Syrian President Bashar al-Assad's Government.
attributes.background: 3 years ago, Parliament rejected a Gov. motion to take action against the Syrian Gov., after receiving evidence of the use of Chemical weapons against the Syrian people. We ask Parliament to reconsider its position following more recent reports of war crimes, including summary killings of civilians.
attributes.additional_details: In 2013, the UN confirmed that the Syrian Government had used chemical weapons against the Syrian people. In recent days there have been increased concerns that the Syrian army and their military supporters are committing both humanitarian and war crimes, including the massacring of families in cold blood. We urge Parliament to approve military action, in order to help in relieving Syrian civilians of their plight, and to deter the Syrian Government from committing such crimes against them.

attributes.action: Make humira free to patients with the eye condition uvietus
attributes.background: Uvietus can make people lose their eyesight , humira is known to settle the uvietus down and stop it flaring up giving the patient a chance of getting their eyes operated on , ie cataract operation. This drug is free in Scotland and Wales but not from NHS England . Why

attributes.action:
Provide CCTV in all Care homes (
Special Needs, Disabled, Dementia, Elderly)
attributes.background: I am a single mum with a son who has autism and should he live in a care home, when i am no longer around, I want him to be protected and all his care to be recorded in case of negligence or abuse.

attributes.action: Establish a 7 day celebration of tireless efforts by NHS workers 365 days a year
attributes.background: My mum recently attended Hospital for a hip replacement where she was cared for by many wonderful NHS workers over a five day period including a weekend. I felt that my few words of appreciation to the staff needed reinforcing through a national campaign aimed at thanking all NHS workers in the UK.

attributes.action: Prevent privatisation of any aspect of Children's Protective Services in the UK
attributes.background: Children deserve to be protected by a system that is not privately controlled and therefore accountable to shareholders. Children's Protective Services must remain within Local Authority control as a Statutory Duty to protect children from avoidable harm.
attributes.additional_details:
Privitisation may allow confused prioritIes for providers that could lead to vulnerable children being abused.

We all have a duty to safeguard children which is a public necessity not a private and financial one.

attributes.action: Invest more money into scientific research to find the cause of M.E / CFS
attributes.background: M.E./CFS is a debilitating autoimmune disease currently affecting 250,000 people in the UK. Many sufferers are unable to work or care for themselves, and 25% of M.E. patients are bedbound. Most M.E. sufferers are on ESA or disability benefits, causing a significant economic burden.
attributes.additional_details: No universally effective treatment exists for M.E. Current NHS treatments for the illness are based on the controversial PACE trial, and have been found ineffective or even harmful. Good quality research into the root cause of the illness is needed. The current annual budget for biomedical research works at roughly £1 per patient per year. We want the budget for research to be dramatically increased. We also ask for the formation of a work group focussing on the issues surrounding this disease.

attributes.action: Do not allow the sale of our utilities to foreign companies
attributes.background: A Chinese consortium are trying to purchase a majority stake in National Grid's £11billion gas distribution network. The Prime Minister promised tighter regulations on foreign investments in the UK, it seems to be an empty promise. Our utilities need to stay under British control. Sign if you agree.

attributes.action: Make June 23 a bank holiday to celebrate UK Independence Day.
attributes.background: To celebrate the EU referendum historic result where the people of the UK voted to regain independence from the EU.
attributes.additional_details: The people have spoken and voted for a self Governing UK. This wonderful example of democratic success deserves to be remembered forever. A bank holiday would enable the people to celebrate the occasion.

attributes.action: Make our Waters Safe- Licensing and Alcohol Regulation of Watercraft
attributes.background: The Railways & Transportation Safety Act of 2003 in Section 80 already starts to cover the control of being under the influence, all it needs is to be signed by the Minister of Shipping (Robert Goodwill MP) for it to be enforced. This can then also be expanded into licensing watercraft.
attributes.additional_details:
British Waters are one of only a few that don’t require a license to operate leisure craft on the water, nor is there any regulation on being under the influence of alcohol or drugs. Most European countries, Australia and the USA all require a license to operate a vessel on the water. The US Coastguard name alcohol in their top five contributing factors of accidents. 
Lives at sea matter. We have legislation for our roads, why not our waters. 
For more info: www.facebook.com/makeourwaterssafe

attributes.action: Change the way in which property is bought and sold in England
attributes.background: My family and I have recently been left in a bad position, because of a supposedly reliable cash buyer pulling out of purchasing our flat, a week before we were going to be moving into our newly built family home.
attributes.additional_details: I would like a legally binding contract in place at an earlier stage (for example when a price is agreed) during the property buying and selling process. This will give the seller the confidence to start spending money on their next purchase, and not be worrying about if the buyer is going to back out. If a buyer then backs out without good reason then they will be liable for all the costs that the seller has incurred, and the buyer should also lose their deposit.

attributes.action: Make appropriate sex education for LGBT+ people mandatory in schools.
attributes.background: We, as young people, have very limited access to sex education in school...so when it comes to sex education regarding LGBT+ people, there is essentially nothing! This needs to change or more than just people's education could be negatively impacted. People's health could be at great risk!
attributes.additional_details: We had to visit specific charities and organisations to receive any information regarding LGBT+ sexual health. This is just not okay as it puts people at risk and creates a separation between peers (solely due to their sexuality/gender).

attributes.action: Review family courts and cafcass mode of operation and predjudicial views.
attributes.background: A request that a Parliamentary commitee be set up to review the way family courts are conducted, the basis of evidence that they and cafcass depend on to make decisions, and the way family courts and CAFCASS are biased towards the mothers wishes over the fathers, more importantly the childs needs.
attributes.additional_details:
It is widely viewed amongst society that fathers are heavily penalised in child contact cases, and that all support is heavily biased towards mothers. 

Many fathers are wrongfully accused and a scan of mothers forums show evidence of collaboration in what accusations to make to prevent/limit contact. CAFCASS are complicit in these activities and their case workers highly prejudiced. Mothers are not held accountable for falsifying accusations.

attributes.action: A Royal Yacht with duel role to promote trade around the world must be built.
attributes.background: Nowhere on Britannia's side did you see her name, yet she was recognised around the world. She should be  built for the dual role of signing trade agreements and promoting British trade delegations and act as a base for state visits by Her Majesty.
attributes.additional_details: https://youtu.be/VtghpGfgPRM

attributes.action: Stop the sale and import of dyed fish in the UK. It is cruel and unnecessary
attributes.background: Stop the sale and import of dyed fish. Fish are beautiful in their own right. Injecting them with dye is cruel and unnecessary. It is illegal to dye them yourself in the UK but not to import them. The fish suffer and it shortens their life span.

attributes.action: Urinary Tract Infections tested for and prescribed for by a pharmacist not a GP.
attributes.background: A UTI can be debilitating, testing and treatment at a pharmacy saves women the hassle of waiting for an appointment or call back from the GP for a prescription of antibiotics. It would save the NHS the cost and time of a GP testing and prescribing for a UTI.
attributes.additional_details: I have suffered with a UTI during NHS out of hours and had to travel (in pain) many miles for treatment. It can take 24 hours or more to receive treatment, much of which wastes NHS time and has caused myself and other women a great deal of distress. If I could be tested and treated solely at a pharmacy it would save many women time and pain and would save wasting GP time.
